H0.text: Superconductors are materials that can conduct electricity with 100% efficiency, meaning no energy is lost during electrical transmission.

H1.text: Poor conductors are materials able to conduct electricity with 100% efficiency, meaning that no energy is lost during the electrical transmission.

H2.text: Electromagnets are materials able to conduct electricity with 100% efficiency, meaning that no energy is lost during electrical transmission.

H3.text: Super-insulators are materials that conduct electricity with 100% efficiency, meaning that no energy is lost during electrical transmission.

A4.text: Superconductivity is a set of physical properties observed in superconductors: materials where electrical resistance vanishes and magnetic fields are expelled from the material.

A5.text: An electric current through a loop of superconducting wire can persist indefinitely with no power source.
